thread.title: Lions and Spartans prepare for Capital Division Clash
thread.title_full: Lions and Spartans prepare for Capital Division Clash

title: Lions and Spartans prepare for Capital Division Clash
text:
Lions and Spartans prepare for Capital Division Clash 
Updated: 
Posted by: Shannel Douglas 

CAMP HILL – The Camp Hill Lions and the Milton Hershey Spartans are preparing for a Capital Division showdown Friday night. 

"We’re excited to get our first real test of the year,” explains Camp Hill Quarterback, Michael Shuster. “We feel like the past couple of games we played teams that really weren't up to our level and we know that we can compete with teams better than that." 

"We're better than them in every aspect of the game,” said Milton Hershey Cornerback, Earl Quermorllue. “I have full confidence in my team.” 

Camp Hill coming into Friday’s match-up undefeated at 4-0. The Lions know this week won’t be as easy. 

"We've been playing pretty well,” said Camp Hill Head Coach, Frank Gay. “We want to continue to play well. We talk each week about taking it one game at a time and it's week 5." 

The Spartans on the other hand are sitting at 3-1. Week after week this team has been tested. Week after week they have shown what they can do. 

"I think after the Steel-High game I think we're pretty much set for the rest of our games,” said Milton Hershey Wide Receiver, Tyeair Diggs. “We have a lot of speed and stuff like that so a lot of teams can't keep up with us.” 

The last time these two teams met, Milton Hershey took the win 25-23. Both teams are coming into Friday’s game expecting another battle. 

"I look at Camp Hill like any other team,” said Quermorllue. “I just feel like we're going to beat them just like any other team. “ 

"I think we'll do really well,” said Camp Hill Wide Receiver, David Fetrow. “We haven't beat them for a while. But I think this year we have a good chance at beating them.” 

Kick-off is set for 7pm at Siebert Park in Camp Hill. Related Stories
